Key Match Events: Pathum Nissanka hit a gutsy half-century (67 off 45)
Mark Wood's 3 for 26 helped England restrict Sri Lanka to 141 for 8
Ben Stokes' unbeaten 42 off 36 took England through
Adil Rashid took 3 wickets in the final over to seal the victory
Pre-Game Insights: Jos Buttler says that it was not a great watch but he knew they have to find a way and he is glad that they did it in the end.
Dasun Shanaka says that it was an amazing fight but feels that they could have done better with the bat.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler praises Ben Stokes for his knock and is relieved that they crossed the line.
Dasun Shanaka states that they played good cricket in patches and a few injuries didn't help their cause.
Adil Rashid says that it's always good for the bowlers to get some assistance and calls it a great team effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England won the game by 4 wickets in Sydney.
Dasun Shanaka won the toss and elected to bat first.
Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka hit a half-century while England's Mark Wood took 3 wickets.
Others: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka had won the toss and elected to bat.
England's Jos Buttler and Alex Hales added 75 runs for the opening wicket.
The presentation ceremony followed the match.
